titleText: Microsoft Azure customers now can run workloads on Cray supercomputers
mainText: Microsoft and Cray are enabling Azure customers to run certain workloads on Cray supercomputing hardware that's installed in Microsoft datacenters. The pair announced on October 23 that customers in select Microsoft datacenters will have the option.

titleText: Microsoft’s cloud taps into Cray’s supercomputers
mainText: The partnership between Microsoft and Cray aims to deliver more high-performance computing power to Azure customers, especially those that manage massive sets of data used for artificial intelligence technology. Microsoft is bringing extra oomph to its.

titleText: Original Xbox backward compatibility games start appearing in Microsoft’s store
mainText: Microsoft revealed at E3 earlier this year that the Xbox One will be backwards compatible with some original Xbox games. It appears the feature is ready to launch, as original Xbox games are now appearing.
